reporter_caption.center: COLLINS v. CHICAGO, BURLINGTON QUINCY R. CO., 250 Ill. App. 663 (1929)

caption.center: S.C. Collins, defendant in error, v. Chicago, Burlington Quincy Railroad

court.center: Appellate Court of Illinois, Second District.

date.center: Rehearing denied and opinion modified February 6, 1929.

opinion.posture:
Action for damage to truck struck by train. Judgment for plaintiff.
Error to the Circuit Court of Peoria county; the Hon. Joseph E. Daily, Judge, presiding. Heard in this court at the May term, 1928.
opinion.attorneys: J.A. Connell and Jack, Irwin Jack, for plaintiff in error. Shelton F. McGrath and Arthur B. Copeland, for defendant in error.
opinion.opinion_byline: Mr. Justice Jett delivered the opinion of the court.
opinion.opinion_text: Reversed and remanded. Opinion filed October 15, 1928.Page 664
